title: Reese Witherspoon Is Bringing Back This ’80s-Inspired Trend in the Kitchen (It’s So Cute!)
description: It might be your new go-to! READ MORE...
author: Ashia Aubourg
excerpt: It might be your new go-to!
text: GroceriesProduct Reviews & RecommendationsWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Photo: Theo Wargo/Getty Images; Design: The KitchnThe 1980s saw plenty of fashion and home trends, but one has stood the test of time: plaid. Sure, the pattern itself predates the ’80s, and the way people wear and decorate with plaid has changed over the years — from school uniforms to blankets and curtains — but it’s stuck around in one way or another. Recently, Reese Witherspoon shared a video of herself wearing an apron featuring a classic plaid design, solidifying the pattern as a mainstay in any decade.The actress and producer shared a clip of herself decorating sugar cookies while listening to an audiobook of her December book club pick. What really stood out in the video, though, was Witherspoon’s monogrammed red-and-black plaid apron. She paired it with a simple black top underneath, and the whole look was giving off holiday vibes.If you want to channel Witherspoon’s kitchen look and also bring back memories of the ’80s with a modern-day twist, there are similar — and equally cute — plaid aprons available online. There’s this one from Urban Outfitters that has a hint of blue in it; Sur La Table’s version sticks true to the red and black. Neither apron comes with the option to monogram it like Witherspoon’s, but you could always embroider your name on the apron yourself.
html:
• Groceries
  • Product Reviews & Recommendations

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

The 1980s saw plenty of fashion and home trends, but one has stood the test of time: plaid. Sure, the pattern itself predates the ’80s, and the way people wear and decorate with plaid has changed over the years — from school uniforms to blankets and curtains — but it’s stuck around in one way or another. Recently, Reese Witherspoon shared a video of herself wearing an apron featuring a classic plaid design, solidifying the pattern as a mainstay in any decade.

The actress and producer shared a clip of herself decorating sugar cookies while listening to an audiobook of her December book club pick. What really stood out in the video, though, was Witherspoon’s monogrammed red-and-black plaid apron. She paired it with a simple black top underneath, and the whole look was giving off holiday vibes.

If you want to channel Witherspoon’s kitchen look and also bring back memories of the ’80s with a modern-day twist, there are similar — and equally cute — plaid aprons available online. There’s this one from Urban Outfitters that has a hint of blue in it; Sur La Table’s version sticks true to the red and black. Neither apron comes with the option to monogram it like Witherspoon’s, but you could always embroider your name on the apron yourself.
